original:
This system remained in place until the reforms in medical training that occurred in 1993 and 2003. In addition to his teaching responsibilities, he collected numerous vertebrate skeletons for his museum of comparative anatomy and published over 70 research papers. He gained particular recognition for his public dissection of the Tay Whale.

In 1822, the Royal College of Surgeons began regulating the teaching of anatomy in medical schoo
